title: Orange
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Orange/ko "Orange/ko")

 • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Orange/zh-CN "Orange/zh-CN")

| % [![Orange.png](/images/4/43/Orange.png)](/wiki/File:Orange.png) |                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | orange                                 |
| Base price                                                        | 9 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")        |
| Nutrition                                                         | [80](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")      |
| Turns to eat                                                      | 1                                      |
| Weight                                                            | [2](/wiki/Weight "Weight")             |
| Conduct                                                           | [vegan](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

An **orange** is a type of [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy") [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") start each game with 5-10 oranges.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") may start with oranges among their random food items.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), delicatessens and health food stores can sell oranges.

[Kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") a tree has a one-time 14⁄15 chance of dropping (8−[rnl](/wiki/Rnl "Rnl")(7)) fruits, which may be oranges.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Cutting down a tree has a 1⁄5 chance of producing a piece of fruit that can be an orange.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) If a tree is [tunneled](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through, there is a 1⁄3 chance of fruit being left behind, which can be an orange.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [charged](/wiki/Charged "Charged") [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 0.9% chance of generating an orange or two.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Description

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") an orange confers 80 nutrition. Oranges are vegan, and can be used to tame [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster").

If the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") eats a [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") of any type while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating"), they will turn into an orange instead of a pile of [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"). If the player is polymorphed into an orange in a [vault](/wiki/Vault "Vault"), [guards](/wiki/Guards "Guards") will question who left the orange in the vault.

## History

The orange first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the Pacman [random vault](/wiki/Random_vault_\(UnNetHack\) "Random vault (UnNetHack)") has a guaranteed orange at a random position.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), [Bards](/wiki/Bard "Bard") start each game with 3-6 oranges; [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier "Incantifier") Bards and Monks have their oranges replaced with scrolls of [food detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_food_detection "Scroll of food detection"). [Clockwork automaton](/wiki/Clockwork_Automaton_\(starting_race\) "Clockwork Automaton (starting race)") characters in roles that would start with oranges instead receive potions of [oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the last floor of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") has 3 oranges in the lower-right [crystal chest](/wiki/Crystal_chest "Crystal chest") within the central room of the castle.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), Bards start each game with 3-6 oranges as in dNetHack, and incantifier Bards and Monks receive scrolls of food detection instead.

## Encyclopedia entry

The pear and [orange]() share an [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry:

What was the fruit like? Unfortunately, no one can describe a taste. All I can say is that, compared with those fruits, the freshest grapefruit you've ever eaten was dull, and the juiciest orange was dry, and the most melting pear was hard and woody, and the sweetest wild strawberry was sour. And there were no seeds or stones, and no wasps. If you had once eaten that fruit, all the nicest things in this world would taste like medicines after it. But I can't describe it. You can't find out what it is like unless you can get to that country and taste it for yourself.

\[ The Last Battle, by C.S. Lewis ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 93](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L93)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L144)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1115](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dokick.c#L1115)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 398](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L398)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L1321)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L2219): *any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible*

Orange

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name orange
Base price 9 zm
Nutrition 80
Turns to eat 1
Weight 2
Conduct vegan

An orange is a type of veggy comestible that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 UnNetHack
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 EvilHack
    • 4.4 SlashTHEM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Monks start each game with 5-10 oranges.[1] Tourists may start with oranges among their random food items.[2]

General stores, delicatessens and health food stores can sell oranges.

Kicking a tree has a one-time 14⁄15 chance of dropping (8−rnl(7)) fruits, which may be oranges.[3] Cutting down a tree has a 1⁄5 chance of producing a piece of fruit that can be an orange.[4] If a tree is tunneled through, there is a 1⁄3 chance of fruit being left behind, which can be an orange.[5]

Applying a charged horn of plenty has a 0.9% chance of generating an orange or two.[6]

Description

Eating an orange confers 80 nutrition. Oranges are vegan, and can be used to tame domestic herbivorous monsters.

If the hero eats a mimic corpse of any type while hallucinating, they will turn into an orange instead of a pile of gold. If the player is polymorphed into an orange in a vault, guards will question who left the orange in the vault.

History

The orange first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial item list for Hack 1.0.

Variants

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the Pacman random vault has a guaranteed orange at a random position.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, Bards start each game with 3-6 oranges; incantifier Bards and Monks have their oranges replaced with scrolls of food detection. Clockwork automaton characters in roles that would start with oranges instead receive potions of oil.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the last floor of the Ice Queen's Realm has 3 oranges in the lower-right crystal chest within the central room of the castle.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, Bards start each game with 3-6 oranges as in dNetHack, and incantifier Bards and Monks receive scrolls of food detection instead.

Encyclopedia entry

The pear and orange share an encyclopedia entry:

What was the fruit like? Unfortunately, no one can describe a taste. All I can say is that, compared with those fruits, the freshest grapefruit you've ever eaten was dull, and the juiciest orange was dry, and the most melting pear was hard and woody, and the sweetest wild strawberry was sour. And there were no seeds or stones, and no wasps. If you had once eaten that fruit, all the nicest things in this world would taste like medicines after it. But I can't describe it. You can't find out what it is like unless you can get to that country and taste it for yourself.

[ The Last Battle, by C.S. Lewis ]

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 93
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144
  3. ↑ src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1115
  4. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 398
  5. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321
  6. ↑ src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219: any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible

An '''orange''' is a type of [[veggy]] [[comestible]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
[[Monk]]s start each game with 5-10 oranges.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|93|nethack=3.6.7}} [[Tourist]]s may start with oranges among their random food items.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|144|nethack=3.6.7}}

General [[store]]s, delicatessens and health food stores can sell oranges.

[[Kick]]ing a tree has a one-time {{frac|14|15}} chance of dropping (8−[[rnl]](7)) fruits, which may be oranges.{{refsrc|src/dokick.c|1115|nethack=3.6.7}} Cutting down a tree has a {{frac|5}} chance of producing a piece of fruit that can be an orange.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|398|nethack=3.6.7}} If a tree is [[tunnel]]ed through, there is a {{frac|3}} chance of fruit being left behind, which can be an orange.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|1321|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Apply]]ing a [[charged]] [[horn of plenty]] has a 0.9% chance of generating an orange or two.{{refsrc|src/mkobj.c|2219|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible}}

==Description==
[[Eating]] an orange confers 80 nutrition. Oranges are vegan, and can be used to tame [[domestic]] [[herbivorous]] [[monster]]s.

If the [[hero]] eats a [[mimic]] [[corpse]] of any type while [[hallucinating]], they will turn into an orange instead of a pile of [[gold]]. If the player is polymorphed into an orange in a [[vault]], [[guards]] will question who left the orange in the vault.

==History==
The orange first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]].

==Variants==
===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], the Pacman [[Random vault (UnNetHack)|random vault]] has a guaranteed orange at a random position.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], [[Bard]]s start each game with 3-6 oranges; [[incantifier]] Bards and Monks have their oranges replaced with scrolls of {{? of|food detection}}. [[Clockwork Automaton (starting race)|Clockwork automaton]] characters in roles that would start with oranges instead receive potions of {{! of|oil}}.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the last floor of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]] has 3 oranges in the lower-right [[crystal chest]] within the central room of the castle.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], Bards start each game with 3-6 oranges as in dNetHack, and incantifier Bards and Monks receive scrolls of food detection instead.

==Encyclopedia entry==
The pear and [[orange]] share an [[encyclopedia]] entry:

{{encyclopedia|
What was the fruit like?  Unfortunately, no one can describe a taste.  All I can say is that, compared with those fruits, the freshest grapefruit you've ever eaten was dull, and the juiciest orange was dry, and the most melting pear was hard and woody, and the sweetest wild strawberry was sour.  And there were no seeds or stones, and no wasps.  If you had once eaten that fruit, all the nicest things in this world would taste like medicines after it.  But I can't describe it.  You can't find out what it is like unless you can get to that country and taste it for yourself.
|[ The Last Battle, by C.S. Lewis ]
}}
